contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox River | river_name = Quinto River | image_name = Río Quinto.jpg | caption = Quinto River passing Villa Mercedes (2008) | origin = Sierra de San Luis | mouth = Bañados de la Amarga | basin_countries = [[Argentina]] | length = 375 km (or more) | elevation = | discharge = 6.22 m³/s | watershed = 1165 km² }} The '''Quinto River''' ({{lang-es|Río Quinto}}), also known as the '''Popopis''', is in central [[Argentina]]. It rises in [[Sierra de San Luis]] near the Retama mountain in [[San Luis Province]]. The Quinto flows to the southeast. Near the [[Paso de las Carreteras]] dam, the Quinto River begins to flow though the [[Pampas]]. It passes [[Villa Mercedes, San Luis|Villa Mercedes]] city, where it is about 45 m wide. It then flows through [[Córdoba Province (Argentina)|Córdoba Province]]. Finally, it flows into the [[Bañados de la Amarga]] swamps in its lower course. During the rainy season the Quinto's waters sometimes rise sufficiently to reach [[Santa Fé Province|Santa Fé]] and [[Buenos Aires Province]]s and sometimes even as far as the [[Salado River, Argentina|Salado River]] basin. The Quinto's length is dependent on the season. It can vary from 375 km in the dry period to 878 km after heavy rain. {{coord missing|Argentina}} [[Category:Rivers of Argentina]] {{argentina-geo-stub}}
